1066-20250406:cc3ff37a78dfc96c3010e09f4a.narrativeSummary: This series traces the climactic year 1066, charting how a throne dispute spiraled into invasions, battles, and a sweeping conquest. From Harold Godwinson’s stand against Harald Hardrada and William of Normandy to the aftermath that reshaped England’s rulers and landscape, it reveals how a single year forged a new English realm.
1066-20250406:cc3ff37a78dfc96c3010e09f4a.seriesTitle: 1066: War, Invasion, and the Making of England

1922-20220113:bbceda73cbdc50644fedc0c656.narrativeSummary: A two-part exploration of 1922, the year many historians mark as the birth of the modern world. Part 1 surveys the political upheavals and cultural revolutions of the time—Bolshevism, fascism, and landmark works like The Waste Land and Ulysses. Part 2 traces the era's lasting legacies, from the Irish Civil War and the BBC to cultural phenomena like Tutmania, tying these threads to how 1922 helped shape the 20th century.
1922-20220113:bbceda73cbdc50644fedc0c656.seriesTitle: 1922: The Birth of the Modern World

afghanistan-20210818:762a3eb0bda5b751d41.narrativeSummary: This two-part arc surveys Afghanistan’s pivotal place in world history, tracing how empires rise and fall around its borders. By examining Afghanistan’s relationships with great powers and its role in the Great Game, the series reveals a nation caught between competing ambitions and enduring resilience. Part 1 lays the groundwork, introducing the historical forces that shaped the region and setting the stage for the story to come.
afghanistan-20210818:762a3eb0bda5b751d41.seriesTitle: Afghanistan: Empires, Intrigue, and the Great Game

alexander-the-great-part-1-20211108:b334.narrativeSummary: In this two-part arc, The Rest Is History traces Alexander the Great’s rapid ascent from Macedonia to the far reaches of the known world, weighing his charisma against the costs of empire. The hosts explore conquest, the creation of legend, and the enduring questions about his death and legacy, including how his story reverberates through history, faith, and memory.
alexander-the-great-part-1-20211108:b334.seriesTitle: Alexander the Great: Empire, Myth, and Mystery

alfred-the-great-20221107:30c4d47ba58319.narrativeSummary: Two-part series tracing Alfred the Great as he defends England from Viking invasion, embodies both warrior might and poetic insight, and rises to become England's foundational king. The arc then follows the struggle against Viking power and Alfred's enduring leadership that laid the groundwork for a united England and its legendary kingly legacy.
alfred-the-great-20221107:30c4d47ba58319.seriesTitle: Alfred the Great: Fury of the Vikings to the Return of the King

america-in-68-20241028:a945bfda902828070.narrativeSummary: In six episodes, the series traces a watershed year when the Vietnam War, civil rights struggles, and a volatile political landscape collided to redefine American life. From LBJ's withdrawal and landmark assassinations to Chicago's brutal protests and Nixon's return, the season maps how crisis after crisis reshaped parties, power, and public discourse. Through analysis of these events, the hosts reveal how 1968 set the template for modern American politics—media-driven, polarized, and relentlessly transformative.
america-in-68-20241028:a945bfda902828070.seriesTitle: America in '68: Chaos, Civil Rights, and the Birth of Modern American Politics

american-civil-war-the-causes-20220627:a.narrativeSummary: A four-part exploration of the American Civil War, tracing its origins, the outbreak of fighting, the defining Battle of Gettysburg, and the war's enduring legacy in modern America. Hosted by Tom Holland and Dominic Sandbrook with historian Adam Smith, the series analyzes slavery's role, key figures, battlefield strategy, and Lincoln's aftermath, offering insight into how this conflict shaped the nation.
american-civil-war-the-causes-20220627:a.seriesTitle: American Civil War: From Causes to Legacy

amsterdam-miracles-money-and-mud-2023071.narrativeSummary: Across two episodes, this walking tour of Amsterdam traces the city’s arc from a miraculous pilgrimage hub to a cradle of capitalism and liberalism. Tom and Dominic guide listeners through Dam Square, canals, royal palaces, and coffee houses, while also highlighting the city’s Jewish heritage and its role in shaping modern Europe. Together, they reveal how faith, power, and commerce intertwined to make Amsterdam a city of water, wealth, and wonder.

ancient-carthage-20240219:18d7e90875bd0c.narrativeSummary: Across these episodes, the audience traces Carthage from its Phoenician roots to its emergence as a vast maritime and mercantile empire. The series delves into its seafaring ingenuity, wealth, and political ruthlessness, and paves the way to Rome’s looming challenge. It paints a vivid portrait of a civilization that shaped the Mediterranean world—glittering with innovation and shadowed by violence.
ancient-carthage-20240219:18d7e90875bd0c.seriesTitle: Carthage: Lords of the Sea and the Rise of a Mediterranean Power

ancient-carthage-20240219:495401beb6a215.narrativeSummary: From Phoenician roots to a Punic empire, the episodes trace Carthage’s rise as a maritime power and Rome’s ascent as a disciplined land-based power. The series follows the inexorable clash between these two civilizations and how their rivalry reshaped the Mediterranean world.
ancient-carthage-20240219:495401beb6a215.seriesTitle: Carthage vs Rome: Masters of the Mediterranean

atlantis-20230320:d0ca62e37425d995e87532.narrativeSummary: Two-part journey into the myth of Atlantis, tracing its origins as a legendary tale and the enduring legacies that fuel every claim—from political satire in ancient texts to modern utopian fantasies. As scholars and skeptics debate the truth behind the legend, the series reveals how Atlantis has been co-opted, exploited, and imagined through the ages, shaping ideas about power, invention, and empire.
atlantis-20230320:d0ca62e37425d995e87532.seriesTitle: Atlantis: Legends and the Lost Empire

australian-prime-ministers-20220523:90ed.narrativeSummary: This three-part series traces the arc of Australian prime ministers from the federation era to the contemporary era, moving from Edmund Barton through to Scott Morrison. It highlights the personalities, politics, and pivotal moments that defined Australia’s executive leadership, guided by hosts Tom and Dominic.
australian-prime-ministers-20220523:90ed.seriesTitle: Australian Prime Ministers: From Barton to Morrison – A History of Leadership

baghdad-20231008:4960a8295c079b23f1753c2.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, we chart Baghdad's rise from the Abbasid revolution to its status as a cosmopolitan capital and cultural powerhouse. The city acts as the epicenter where Islam, imperial ambition, science, commerce, and storytelling collide, giving birth to a Golden Age and a lasting global legacy.
baghdad-20231008:4960a8295c079b23f1753c2.seriesTitle: Baghdad: City at the Crossroads of Islam and Empire

britain-in-1974-20240212:dc15e80d9c489c6.narrativeSummary: Set against a backdrop of industrial unrest, economic crisis, and security fears, 1974 becomes a year of seismic political upheaval in Britain. Through these four parts, the series follows the twists of government, elections, and power struggles—and the emergence of Margaret Thatcher on the national stage.
britain-in-1974-20240212:dc15e80d9c489c6.seriesTitle: Britain 1974: Crisis, Elections, and the Rise of Thatcher

captain-cook-20231022:e3df4377bd53482de8.narrativeSummary: This series follows James Cook’s journey from a humble Yorkshire cartographer to history’s greatest explorer, tracing his three Pacific voyages and the scientific aims behind them. Exploring encounters with Tahitians, Maori, and Aboriginal Australians, as well as the politics of Terra Australis, it reveals the human, cultural, and practical complexities of 18th-century exploration. From tracking the transit of Venus to charting new lands with Banks and the Endeavour’s crew, the arc shows how exploration and Enlightenment shaped the wider world.
captain-cook-20231022:e3df4377bd53482de8.seriesTitle: Captain Cook: Voyages to the Ends of the Earth

charlemagne-20241219:9246fa52d0c5e556ea5.narrativeSummary: Charting Charlemagne’s ascent from a Frankish king to emperor, this series follows his ruthless campaigns, political maneuvering, and sweeping religious-educational reforms that reshaped Europe. From his consolidation of power to the birth of a Christian, educated empire, the episodes trace how his reign transformed the West and planted the roots of a shared European identity. Against Rome and Constantinople, and facing external threats like Saracens and Vikings, Charlemagne’s 800 coronation becomes a turning point that forged a lasting legacy in European history.
charlemagne-20241219:9246fa52d0c5e556ea5.seriesTitle: Charlemagne: The Making of Western Europe

china-and-world-war-ii-20220920:53dae57c.narrativeSummary: This two-part arc traces China's long arc from imperial collapse to its wartime footing in World War II, linking the fall of the Qing and the rise of the Republic to Japan's aggression and China's Allied role. It highlights internal power struggles—from warlords and the Kuomintang to Wang Jingwei—and external crises from the Opium Wars to the Nanjing Massacre and the Stilwell-Chiang Kai-shek partnership. Together, the episodes show how historical upheavals set the stage for China's pivotal role in World War II.

columbus-the-adventure-begins-20230220:5.narrativeSummary: From Columbus's Genoese beginnings to the daring Atlantic crossing, this series traces how a single voyage reshaped the world through exploration, power, and ambition. It then probes the aftershocks of discovery—indigenous violence, colonial domination, and the enduring debate over whether Columbus was a pioneering voyager or a figure whose legacy is stained by conquest.

coronations-the-deep-history-20230504:81.narrativeSummary: This series traces how coronation ceremonies have shaped and reflected power—from their ancient roots and sacred rites to their use as political theater. Across three episodes, it surveys ritual detail, scandal and chaos, and the imperial ambitions woven into the crown, revealing what coronations have meant for rulers and empires.
coronations-the-deep-history-20230504:81.seriesTitle: Coronations: Rituals, Power, and Empire Through History

crucifixion-20220414:305003b71f5154a71f5.narrativeSummary: This series traces the brutal history of crucifixion from its origins to its evolution as a public execution, while probing the historical accuracy of Jesus' death. Hosted by Tom and Dominic, it blends history and interpretation to illuminate Easter's darker underpinnings and the myths that have grown around it.
crucifixion-20220414:305003b71f5154a71f5.seriesTitle: Crucifixion: Origins, Evolution, and Historical Truth

crucifixion-20220414:ab861c57f5f4500d98c.narrativeSummary: Across three episodes, the series traces how Rome's crucifixion practices intersected with Jewish resistance and the fate of Judea under empire. It moves from the origins of crucifixion to the destruction of Jerusalem, the burning of the Temple, and Masada, tying these events to their lasting religious and historical legacies. By examining these pivotal moments, the episodes invite listeners to reconsider how ancient Rome and Judaism continue to shape Christianity and the modern world.
crucifixion-20220414:ab861c57f5f4500d98c.seriesTitle: Crucifixion and Revolt: Rome, Judea, and the Making of History

custer-vs-crazy-horse-20240505:8edbc590d.narrativeSummary: A four-part exploration of the clash between U.S. military expansion and Lakota resistance on the Great Plains, from Civil War-era campaigns to Sitting Bull’s rise. The arc traces how modernization, politics, and empire-building collide with Indigenous sovereignty, revealing heroic gambits, brutal campaigns, and tragic consequences on both sides.
custer-vs-crazy-horse-20240505:8edbc590d.seriesTitle: Custer vs Crazy Horse: The Great Plains War

custer-vs-crazy-horse-20240505:9a65221c2.narrativeSummary: From the Civil War era through the late 1870s, the series follows George Custer and the Lakota leaders Crazy Horse and Sitting Bull as their worlds collide on the Great Plains. It traces political intrigue, frontier warfare, and the relentless encroachment of railroads and settlers that push the Lakota toward war, then toward the infamous Little Bighorn. Blending history and legend, it probes what really happened on the fateful last stand and what it reveals about the cost of American expansion.
custer-vs-crazy-horse-20240505:9a65221c2.seriesTitle: Custer vs Crazy Horse: The Last Stand on the Great Plains

elizabeth-i-20251110:4e78143c25082943882.narrativeSummary: Across these episodes, the young Elizabeth I navigates a perilous Tudor court, born into chaos as Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn reshape the realm. From her mother's execution to her status as a royal outcast and survivor of a dangerous political landscape, this arc traces the formative years that forged Britain's future queen. This series sets the stage for Elizabeth's rise and the enduring legacy she would wield over the throne and the nation.
elizabeth-i-20251110:4e78143c25082943882.seriesTitle: Elizabeth I: From Bastard to Queen

elizabeth-i-20251110:cdc7735c9d10650cee7.narrativeSummary: Across three episodes, the series traces Elizabeth I’s perilous road from royal daughter in a brutal Tudor court to a survivor of dynastic upheaval. It delves into Henry VIII’s chase for a male heir, Anne Boleyn’s execution and Elizabeth’s precarious status as a bastard, and the narrow escape from the Tower that sets the stage for her eventual rise to power.
elizabeth-i-20251110:cdc7735c9d10650cee7.seriesTitle: Elizabeth I: Birth, Betrayal, and the Tower

elizabeth-i-20251110:f476961f093c6788159.narrativeSummary: This series traces how Elizabeth I’s ascent began amid Henry VIII’s volatile court and the dynastic pressures that defined Tudor Britain. From Henry’s obsession with a male heir and the downfall of Anne Boleyn to the making of Britain’s greatest queen, the episodes explore personal cost, political cunning, and the forces that shaped a nation. Through court intrigue, religious upheaval, and statecraft, Elizabeth’s emergence becomes a lens on the birth of a new Britain.
elizabeth-i-20251110:f476961f093c6788159.seriesTitle: Elizabeth I and the Tudor World: From Court Intrigue to the Crown

emperors-of-rome-20250127:19b7c4c7f701de.narrativeSummary: A four-part deep dive into Suetonius' Lives of the Caesars, examining how sex, scandal, and power shaped Rome's first emperors. From Augustus' showmanship to Claudius' paranoia, the series peels back myths to reveal the human ambitions, infighting, and sudden downfalls that defined an empire. By weighing spectacle against statecraft, it unveils the uneasy line between private desire and public duty in ancient Rome.
emperors-of-rome-20250127:19b7c4c7f701de.seriesTitle: Emperors of Rome: Secrets, Scandal and the Rise of the Caesars

evita-20240915:e92e8cb2bda07750e1f761e19.narrativeSummary: This series traces Eva Perón's improbable ascent from humble origins to a monumental political figure, charting her partnership with Perón, her appeal to the working class, and her transformation into Evita, the world's most powerful woman. It culminates in her death and the bizarre mystery of her missing body, exploring how a public myth outlived a public life.
evita-20240915:e92e8cb2bda07750e1f761e19.seriesTitle: Evita: Birth, Rise, Power — The Making and Vanishing of a Global Icon

fall-of-saigon-the-nightmare-begins-2023.narrativeSummary: These two episodes chart the last days of American presence in Saigon in 1975, as withdrawal orders trigger chaos and a city gripped by fear. From the embassy crowds to the final helicopters, they unpack the nightmare and the lasting legacies of intervention and collapse. A window into rapid evacuation, upheaval, and the end of an era.
fall-of-saigon-the-nightmare-begins-2023.seriesTitle: Fall of Saigon: The Final Hours (Parts 1-2)

fall-of-the-sioux-20240526:6a2ace51d1a61.narrativeSummary: A three-part journey through the Lakota Sioux collapse after the Battle of the Little Bighorn. It tracks Crazy Horse’s death, the rise of the Ghost Dance, and the tragic Wounded Knee massacre, set against the pressures of U.S. policy and empire. Together, these episodes chart the end of a nomadic era and a devastating chapter in American history.
fall-of-the-sioux-20240526:6a2ace51d1a61.seriesTitle: Fall of the Sioux: From Crazy Horse to Wounded Knee

french-presidents-20220425:23ce080373453.narrativeSummary: This two-part series surveys France’s post-war presidents, tracing how each leader—from Charles de Gaulle to Emmanuel Macron—helped shape the Fifth Republic and France’s role on the world stage. Tom and Dominic explore the politics, challenges, and legacies across the decades, offering a clear arc of modern France from the 1958 founding to today.
french-presidents-20220425:23ce080373453.seriesTitle: French Presidents of the Fifth Republic: 1958–Today (Two-Part History)

greek-myths-20250921:9e3ec6e8a9230dcdcc6.narrativeSummary: An immersive overview of Greek myth, tracing the origins of the Olympian gods, the deeds of legendary heroes, and the plays that defined ancient culture. From Zeus and the Titans to Oedipus, Dionysus, and Jason, the series follows how these stories were told, reinterpreted, and challenged from Hesiod and Homer through the Hellenistic world. Across ritual, tragedy, and voyage, it reveals what these myths reveal about belief, power, and the enduring power of storytelling.
greek-myths-20250921:9e3ec6e8a9230dcdcc6.seriesTitle: Greek Myths: Gods, Prophecies, Tragedies & Heroes

hannibal-20250525:ec01cd81b84e2262e36745.narrativeSummary: This series follows Hannibal’s rise against Rome, from his Carthaginian roots and vow of vengeance to his audacious crossing of the Alps with elephants. It traces the invasion of Italy, the brutal battles that ensued—culminating in the infamous slaughter at Cannae—and the way this clash reshaped Roman and Carthaginian destinies.
hannibal-20250525:ec01cd81b84e2262e36745.seriesTitle: Hannibal and Rome: The Second Punic War

helen-of-troy-20240602:1c6cfd3f5fb4635ed.narrativeSummary: Two-part journey into Helen of Troy and the wider web of myths that surround her. From the regal image of a queen of the Greek myths to the bloody dynastic dramas of Mycenae, the series asks what is true about Helen and why her story persists in legend.
helen-of-troy-20240602:1c6cfd3f5fb4635ed.seriesTitle: Helen of Troy: Queens, Bloodlines, and the Legacy of Myth

henry-iv-20240818:291ffe121a71fdad64b725.narrativeSummary: Across two episodes, we trace Henry IV’s uneasy ascent to the throne, the fractures he inherits, and the brutal rebellions that threaten his legitimacy. The story moves from usurpation to war—facing Hotspur, Welsh and Scottish uprisings, and the shaping of Prince Hal (the future Henry V)—revealing how power, loyalty, and reputation collide in the early Lancastrian era.
henry-iv-20240818:291ffe121a71fdad64b725.seriesTitle: Henry IV: Rebellion, Rule, and the Making of a King

history-s-biggest-questions-with-dan-car.narrativeSummary: Two episodes, featuring Dan Carlin alongside Tom and Dominic, tackle history's biggest questions—from counterfactuals to hypothetical battles and leadership legacies. They explore how alternate outcomes might have reshaped empires, wars, and civilizations, offering a thought-provoking journey through the open-ended questions of the past.
history-s-biggest-questions-with-dan-car.seriesTitle: History's Biggest Questions with Dan Carlin

history-s-greatest-beards-20240908:75438.narrativeSummary: A mini-series tracing how facial hair has shaped power, identity, and culture across the ages. From ancient rulers and religious figures to medieval conquerors, the episodes explore the social meanings, politics, and myths surrounding beards, revealing why a simple beard can symbolize status, rebellion, and enduring controversy.
history-s-greatest-beards-20240908:75438.seriesTitle: Beards Through History: From Ancient Queens to Medieval Conquerors

history-s-greatest-beards-20240908:c726a.narrativeSummary: This two-part series traces how beards have mirrored power, identity, and culture across centuries—from ancient rulers to modern icons. Through stories of political edicts, fashion trends, and legendary figures, the hosts explore why facial hair inspires controversy, admiration, and enduring fascination.
history-s-greatest-beards-20240908:c726a.seriesTitle: Beards Through Time: A History of Facial Hair

hitler-s-war-on-poland-20250113:439cde59.narrativeSummary: From the Munich Agreement to invasion, this multi-part series chronicles Hitler's relentless drive to conquer Poland and reshape Europe. It traces the shifting alliances with Britain, France, and Stalin, and the brutal campaign that culminated in the fall of Warsaw and the dawn of World War II.
hitler-s-war-on-poland-20250113:439cde59.seriesTitle: Hitler's War on Poland: The Road to World War II

hitler-with-ian-kershaw-20210614:d238709.narrativeSummary: In this two-part series, historian Sir Ian Kershaw joins hosts to dissect Adolf Hitler—the embodiment of modern political evil—tracing his ascent, rise to power, and the years leading up to and during the Second World War. Across both episodes, the conversation probes how one man's worldview reshaped history and what his reign reveals about the forces that drove the Nazi era.
hitler-with-ian-kershaw-20210614:d238709.seriesTitle: Hitler, with Ian Kershaw: A Two-Part Exploration

horror-in-the-congo-20250210:ebddde9d81f.narrativeSummary: Across these episodes, the Congo Free State under King Leopold II is laid bare as a brutal engine of extraction, where rubber and ivory were harvested through violence and coercion. The narrative follows whistleblowers and investigators—Morel, Casement, Stanley—whose relentless exposés sparked a global human rights campaign. It is a reckoning with empire, greed, and the birth of modern humanitarian activism.
horror-in-the-congo-20250210:ebddde9d81f.seriesTitle: Horror in the Congo: Empire, Exploitation, and the Birth of Human Rights

hundred-years-war-20240825:4f95d60ceb27e.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, the series follows Henry V’s 1415 invasion of France—from Harfleur to the march across the realm and the pivotal Battle of Agincourt. It weaves together the brutality of siege warfare, the drama of dynastic politics, and the enduring legend of English victory that reshaped the Hundred Years' War. By the end, England’s triumph sits amid a fractured French political landscape and the lasting costs of war.
hundred-years-war-20240825:4f95d60ceb27e.seriesTitle: Henry V and the Hundred Years' War: From Invasion to Agincourt

hundred-years-war-a-game-of-thrones-2023.narrativeSummary: This four-part series traces England and France through the Hundred Years' War, from its chaotic origins to pivotal battles and the meteoric rise of the Black Prince. It combines dynastic politics, battlefield innovation, and enduring hardships—from plague to royal intrigue—to illuminate how power, technology, and leadership shaped a defining century.
hundred-years-war-a-game-of-thrones-2023.seriesTitle: Hundred Years' War: Thrones, Longbows, and the Black Prince

ireland-celts-conquest-and-cromwell-2023.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, this series traces Ireland's turbulent history under external rule—from medieval conquest through union and famine to Home Rule struggles and the 1916 Easter Rising. It reveals how these pivotal moments reshaped Irish sovereignty and Britain's relationship with Ireland, forging the path to modern Ireland.
ireland-celts-conquest-and-cromwell-2023.seriesTitle: Ireland: Conquest, Union, and the Road to the Easter Rising

jesus-christ-the-mystery-20221219:956832.narrativeSummary: Two-part series in which hosts Tom and Dominic examine Jesus Christ through the lens of historical inquiry, tracing the enduring mystery of his life and teachings. They weigh skepticism about his existence and explore theories around his crucifixion and resurrection, as well as the role of his followers. By balancing evidence, interpretation, and belief, the hosts bridge faith and history in a conversation about one of history's most discussed figures.
jesus-christ-the-mystery-20221219:956832.seriesTitle: Jesus Christ: The Mystery and The History

jfk-20231127:e6083e941d9eb35e87019ec7854.narrativeSummary: This series follows John F. Kennedy's ascent to the White House, the turbulence of the Cold War era, and the myth and mystery surrounding his assassination. Across seven episodes, it stitches together political drama, eyewitness accounts, and investigative deep-dives into the suspects, the conspiracy theories, and the hunt for answers. From Camelot to conspiracy, it asks what really happened and how those questions still shape American history.

lady-jane-grey-the-nine-days-queen-20230.narrativeSummary: When Edward VI dies, a volatile succession fight thrust a 15-year-old Lady Jane Grey onto the throne of England. Over the next nine turbulent days, her brief reign, deposition, trial, and execution reveal the fragility of dynastic power and the human costs of political scheming. The series explores memory, manipulation, and the high-stakes drama that shaped Tudor history.
lady-jane-grey-the-nine-days-queen-20230.seriesTitle: Nine Days on the Throne: The Lady Jane Grey Chronicles

londinium-20220718:47d2ae6bddee07bbb3d3f.narrativeSummary: Across five episodes, this arc tours London’s layered history—from the ancient shores of Londinium to modern streets and its haunted corners. It invites listeners to explore the city’s enduring places, the people who shaped it, and the moments that define its past and present.
londinium-20220718:47d2ae6bddee07bbb3d3f.seriesTitle: London Week: Londinium, Haunts, and the City’s People, Places, and Moments

londinium-20220718:af5c035a098a4ffcc3284.narrativeSummary: A five-episode mini-series that threads London's past through its places, people, and moments, anchored by on-location live episodes and a week-long arc. From Londinium to Barking Abbey, the 2i's Coffee Bar, the Royal Menagerie, and the metropolis's railway expansion, Tom and Dominic guide listeners through a rich, immersive tour of the capital's history and lore.

lord-byron-20240414:de01dc386bc3e07fb1a7.narrativeSummary: This series traces Lord Byron’s ascent from troubled youth to Europe’s most infamous celebrity, tracing his scandalous loves, daring travels, and radical poetic ambitions. Across episodes on scandal, liaisons, and political rebellion, Byron’s defiant persona—lover and revolutionary—redefines what it means to be a literary icon. From exile to Greece, the arc culminates in a mythic finale that cements his enduring cultural legacy.
lord-byron-20240414:de01dc386bc3e07fb1a7.seriesTitle: Mad, Bad and Dangerous to Know: The Byron Chronicles

luther-20240325:d98ba147dcbec789d6d033ea.narrativeSummary: From a humble Saxon monk to a radical reformer, Luther's journey reframes theology, authority, and faith. These episodes trace his escalation from door-nailing challenges to imperial confrontations and peasant uprisings, igniting a continental upheaval. Together they reveal how the Reformation reshaped Europe and continues to echo through history.
luther-20240325:d98ba147dcbec789d6d033ea.seriesTitle: Luther: The Reformation That Shook Christendom

mad-elections-20240623:0b43484524df7a25a.narrativeSummary: From the riotous, carnival-like contests of the early modern era to the televised, data-driven campaigns of today, this series traces the astonishing arc of British elections. It explores how spectacle, violence, and shifting media have shaped how Britons vote, and how politicians campaign. Yet beneath the changing methods, echoes of the old chaos, tactics, gaffes, and public fervor remain visible in contemporary politics.
mad-elections-20240623:0b43484524df7a25a.seriesTitle: Elections: From Mad Spectacles to Modern Campaigns

mad-elections-20240623:e798bf577daff18c4.narrativeSummary: From medieval power plays to Victorian clashes, this series peels back the riotous history of British elections. Through tales of street carnivals, dueling MPs, and mass mobilization, it reveals how violence, spectacle, and early party politics helped shape modern democracy. It also asks what echoes remain in today’s electoral theatre.
mad-elections-20240623:e798bf577daff18c4.seriesTitle: Mad Elections: Chronicles of Britain's Electoral Chaos

mary-queen-of-scots-20250720:14e3ff95a9f.narrativeSummary: Spanning birth to downfall, this series traces Mary Queen of Scots' ascent amid dynastic rivalries, royal marriage, and political intrigue, from a perilous infancy to the perilous challenges that threatened her throne. Against a backdrop of fierce Catholic-Protestant conflicts, her bold ambitions clash with Elizabeth I and a web of loyalties, conspiracies, and murder that ultimately determine her fate.
mary-queen-of-scots-20250720:14e3ff95a9f.seriesTitle: Mary, Queen of Scots: A Crown in Crisis

medieval-treason-20221031:6a23430c108604.narrativeSummary: Tom and Dominic trace treason’s long shadow in Britain—from the 1351 treason act to modern upheavals—exploring how definitions, punishments, and political strategy evolve. They examine pivotal episodes and figures—from Charles I’s trial to American independence and the Easter Rising—showing how loyalty, dissent, and state power shape British history.
medieval-treason-20221031:6a23430c108604.seriesTitle: Treason Through Britain: People, Power, and Plot

medieval-treason-20221031:bd49a6feb3f092.narrativeSummary: This multi-part series traces Britain's long history of treason—from medieval statutes to the political intrigues that shaped a nation. Through landmark cases, evolving laws, and the roles of monarchs like Richard III, Henry VIII, and James I, it reveals how treachery, loyalty, and power have driven constitutional change and public imagination.

modern-olympics-20210729:010d9ca6a042dd6.narrativeSummary: Across two episodes, the series traces the Olympic movement from its 1896 revival in Athens to the modern era, uncovering forgotten tales and pivotal moments. The hosts examine how politics, money, media, and technology reshaped the Games—from post-war shifts to Cold War rivalries and the darkest moments in Olympic history. With humor and skepticism, they reveal how the Olympics became a global stage for sport, culture, and spectacle.
modern-olympics-20210729:010d9ca6a042dd6.seriesTitle: The Modern Olympics: From Rebirth to the Present

nelson-20241118:b1c6f48f0e8674870696b350.narrativeSummary: Across five installments, this series traces Horatio Nelson's rise from a boy in Norfolk to Britain's foremost naval commander. It chronicles his daring battles, injuries, and leadership—from Toulon and Calvi to Cape St. Vincent and the Battle of the Nile—and his relentless pursuit of Napoleon that helped secure British naval dominance.

nelson-20251012:3fb06a22607fdda0ee3ba81c.narrativeSummary: Across six episodes, this series traces Horatio Nelson's career during the Napoleonic era - from the Naples intrigue and political storms to pivotal battles at Copenhagen and Trafalgar. It blends naval strategy with political controversy and a volatile personal life as Nelson navigates fame, rivals, and the fate of Britain at sea. The arc culminates in the climactic Trafalgar victory, sealing Nelson's status as one of history's greatest sailors.
nelson-20251012:3fb06a22607fdda0ee3ba81c.seriesTitle: Nelson: From Naples to Trafalgar - A Napoleonic Sea Epic

oppenheimer-the-father-of-the-atom-bomb-.narrativeSummary: This two-part series follows J. Robert Oppenheimer from his pivotal role in creating the atomic bomb to his later fall amid McCarthy-era scrutiny. It examines how scientific achievement intersected with national security and political hysteria in postwar America. It offers a cautionary look at how genius, secrecy, and fear can collide, shaping the fate of individuals and the nuclear age.
oppenheimer-the-father-of-the-atom-bomb-.seriesTitle: Oppenheimer: The Atom Bomb and the Witch Hunt

paris-1968-the-students-revolt-20230724:.narrativeSummary: Tom and Dominic guide listeners through Paris in 1968, tracing how student-led protests grew into a nationwide crisis of strikes, occupations and social upheaval. The two-part arc examines the uprising and De Gaulle’s response, revealing how these moments reshaped French politics and society. Through these events, the series explores the tension between grassroots revolt and national leadership that defined modern France.

peter-the-great-20250504:0db30049a09d144.narrativeSummary: Across these two episodes, we trace Peter the Great’s path from a violent youth to a ruthless autocrat who would reshape Russia and Europe. We explore the court intrigues that propelled his ascent, his bold reforms and foreign travels, and the brutal responses that followed, setting the stage for the Great Northern War. Together they illuminate how one man’s rise and reign transformed an empire.
peter-the-great-20250504:0db30049a09d144.seriesTitle: Peter the Great: Rise, Bloodshed, and Reform

portugal-20220905:38fc2df071adfaf41a23bf.narrativeSummary: From Portugal’s early position on the edge of the known world, through its Golden Age of Discovery and expansive empire, this four-part series traces how exploration, wealth, and global ties shaped the nation. It then moves into the 20th century—two World Wars, Fatima, and the Salazar era—exploring how modern Portugal wrestled with identity, politics, and culture.
portugal-20220905:38fc2df071adfaf41a23bf.seriesTitle: Portugal: From the Edge of the World to the Modern Era

queen-elizabeth-ii-20220909:4d48e35e5622.narrativeSummary: Two-part series tracing Queen Elizabeth II's journey from youth to coronation, and then her seven-decade reign that defined a modern era. It follows her interactions with 15 prime ministers and a vast array of national and international figures, and her role as head of the Commonwealth. The episodes reflect on the monarchy's evolving place in Britain and the world, and the lasting legacy of Queen Elizabeth II.
queen-elizabeth-ii-20220909:4d48e35e5622.seriesTitle: Elizabeth II: A Reign Across Seven Decades

ronald-reagan-and-the-american-dream-202.narrativeSummary: This three-part series traces Ronald Reagan’s trajectory—from humble beginnings and a Hollywood career through California politics to the presidency. It delves into the milestones of his ascent, his domestic and foreign policy decisions, and the controversies that have defined his legacy. By examining his role in shaping the late 20th century, the episodes explore how Reagan fused idealism with pragmatism and what that means for the American story.
ronald-reagan-and-the-american-dream-202.seriesTitle: The Reagan Era: From the American Dream to the Cold War Presidency

ronald-reagan-and-the-american-dream-202.narrativeSummary: This three-part series traces Ronald Reagan's journey from a modest Illinois upbringing to the cusp of political power. It surveys his early career—from sports broadcasting and acting to union leadership—and the experiences that propelled him toward the Republican path, all framed by the idea of chasing the American Dream. By focusing on his childhood, early relationships, and the initial steps into politics, the arc sets up a larger portrait of the man who would redefine American conservatism.
ronald-reagan-and-the-american-dream-202.seriesTitle: Ronald Reagan and the American Dream: Origins and Ascent

silicon-valley-20210906:be84a6071893b927.narrativeSummary: From its origins in military technology to the rise of social media, this series examines how Silicon Valley reshaped modern life. Guided by Marc Andreessen's perspectives, it considers whether software is magic, how online platforms influence politics, and how digital culture has become central to everyday life. The arc reveals both the transformative potential and the skeptical caution that accompanied the web's evolution.
silicon-valley-20210906:be84a6071893b927.seriesTitle: Silicon Valley: From Web Origins to Digital Society

sixties-fashion-20230827:53b94c6efbc4a1d.narrativeSummary: This series traces Britain's pivotal role in shaping 1960s fashion, from post-war restrictions to a youth-driven style boom. It explores the birth of the miniskirt, the Swinging London scene, and the era's iconic photographers, musicians, and boutiques. Fashion becomes a lens on identity, rebellion, and social transformation during the decade.
sixties-fashion-20230827:53b94c6efbc4a1d.seriesTitle: Sixties Fashion: The Teenage Revolution to Swinging London

the-1973-chilean-coup-20230920:ef0393399.narrativeSummary: A two-part exploration of Chile's 1973 coup, tracing Salvador Allende's presidency, the United States' involvement, and General Pinochet's ascent to power. The series delves into Cold War tensions and the collapse of democratic processes that allowed the coup. It also reflects on the human cost and enduring impact on Chilean society.
the-1973-chilean-coup-20230920:ef0393399.seriesTitle: Chile 1973: The Coup, Allende, and the Rise of Pinochet

the-american-revolution-20230703:0442098.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, this series traces the American Revolution from colonial grievances to national birth. It covers the key moments of taxation debates, the Boston Tea Party, independence, and the decisive victories that culminated in Yorktown and the Treaty of Paris, led by George Washington.
the-american-revolution-20230703:0442098.seriesTitle: The American Revolution: From Colony to Country

the-american-revolution-20230703:a8afe4b.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, the series traces how colonial tensions over taxation and representation evolved into a pursuit of independence grounded in Enlightenment liberal democracy and constitutional principles. Through expert dialogue and historical context, it explores the birth of the United States and the ideological foundations that shaped a new nation.
the-american-revolution-20230703:a8afe4b.seriesTitle: The American Revolution: From Grievances to Liberty

the-assassination-of-abraham-lincoln-202.narrativeSummary: Two-part series tracing the final days of Abraham Lincoln, the assassination at Ford's Theatre, and the ensuing nationwide manhunt, revealing the immediate shock and the pursuit of the killer. It also probes the longer-term impact of Lincoln's death on the future of race relations in the United States.
the-assassination-of-abraham-lincoln-202.seriesTitle: The Lincoln Assassination: Death at the Theatre and the Hunt

the-battle-of-stalingrad-20220725:3f9bb0.narrativeSummary: A concise exploration of the decisive battles that shaped World War II, unpacking their context, ferocity, and lasting impact. Beginning with Stalingrad (Part 1) and continuing with follow-ups, the series traces how these clashes redirected the war and reshaped history.
the-battle-of-stalingrad-20220725:3f9bb0.seriesTitle: World War II Battles: Turning Points

the-battle-of-stalingrad-20220725:9e316e.narrativeSummary: These two episodes trace the build-up and outbreak of the Battle of Stalingrad and then the climactic Red Army counteroffensive that shattered the Axis hold. Guided by historian Iain MacGregor, the arc shows how the siege redefined World War II and set the course for the Soviet victory.
the-battle-of-stalingrad-20220725:9e316e.seriesTitle: Stalingrad: The Battle That Turned the Tide

the-falklands-war-20220328:adc09d0c60853.narrativeSummary: This four-part series chronicles the Falklands War from its build-up and invasion through the British Task Force's voyage and core battles to the conflict's lasting legacy in the UK and Argentina. It weaves political drama, media narratives, and personal testimonies to show how memory of the war reshaped national narratives and continues to echo in modern political discourse.
the-falklands-war-20220328:adc09d0c60853.seriesTitle: The Falklands War: A Four-Part Chronicle - From Invasion to Aftermath

the-fall-of-the-aztecs-20231106:4302b722.narrativeSummary: This series follows the dramatic fall of the Aztec Empire, tracing Hernán Cortés's voyage from the Caribbean to Tenochtitlan, the web of alliances and betrayals, and the brutal siege that seals the empire's fate. It examines the collision of civilizations—the lure of gold, the agency of indigenous peoples, the figure of Malinche, and the enduring legacies of conquest for Mexico and world history.
the-fall-of-the-aztecs-20231106:4302b722.seriesTitle: The Fall of the Aztecs: Cortés, Conquest, and the Collision of Worlds

the-first-world-war-20250824:6aeab219e69.narrativeSummary: An in-depth look at the war's birth in 1914, tracing how a continent-wide conflict began with the invasion of Belgium and spiraled into brutal battles on both the Western and Eastern fronts. From the Miracle on the Marne to the fall of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, the episodes illuminate the decisions, tactics, and human cost that shaped the opening year of World War I.
the-first-world-war-20250824:6aeab219e69.seriesTitle: The First World War: Outbreak, Frontiers, and Empires

the-french-revolution-20240728:2ca75f800.narrativeSummary: This eight-episode arc traces the opening years of the French Revolution, weaving together royal intrigue, political crisis and popular upheaval. From Marie Antoinet te's world of courtly spectacle to the storming of the Bastille, the Women's March on Versailles, and the Declaration of the Rights of Man, the series shows how crisis and conviction reshaped France and reverberated across the globe.
the-french-revolution-20240728:2ca75f800.seriesTitle: The French Revolution: From Versailles to the Rights of Man

the-french-revolution-20241013:8df82e720.narrativeSummary: From the Champs de Mars bloodshed to the storming of the Tuileries, this arc traces the revolution's brutal arc - from street violence and political upheaval to Europe-wide conflict and the rise of the guillotine. It culminates in the birth of a unifying national identity as La Marseillaise is born and takes its place as a rallying war song.
the-french-revolution-20241013:8df82e720.seriesTitle: Blood, War, and the Guillotine: The French Revolution (Parts 1–5)

the-french-revolution-20250303:0a5494869.narrativeSummary: This four-part arc traces the explosive early years of the French Revolution: from the September Massacres that unleashed terror in Paris, to the rise of Marianne as a symbol of Liberty and the pivotal role of women in revolutionary politics. It then follows the collapse of the monarchy as the National Convention proclaims a new order, and culminates in Louis XVI's trial and execution, sealing the republic's birth. Against the backdrop of external threats and internal factional strife, the series reveals how violence, ideas, and symbols together reshaped France—and the world.
the-french-revolution-20250303:0a5494869.seriesTitle: The French Revolution: From Massacre to Republic

the-golden-age-of-japan-20250427:72c4ba1.narrativeSummary: A two-part journey into Japan's Heian golden age, where court intrigue, romance, and literary genius collide. Through Genji's world, and the pioneering voices of Lady Murasaki and Sei Shōnagon, the episodes reveal how women shaped a courtly culture and how literature illuminated power, etiquette, and identity in Imperial Japan.
the-golden-age-of-japan-20250427:72c4ba1.seriesTitle: The Golden Age of Japan: Genji, Court, and the Women Who Wrote It

the-great-northern-war-20250511:9b2a919c.narrativeSummary: This arc traces Peter the Great’s tireless campaign against Sweden, charting how the Great Northern War reshaped northern and eastern Europe. From the Baltic to the Steppes and Poltova, it follows brutal campaigns, betrayals, and decisive battles that forged Russia’s rise—and the emperor’s controversial personal saga along the way.
the-great-northern-war-20250511:9b2a919c.seriesTitle: The Great Northern War: From Baltic Battlefields to Moscow

the-irish-civil-war-20250706:5aeca01ce05.narrativeSummary: This series traces the Irish Civil War’s pivotal moments—from high-stakes assassinations to open fighting and the deaths of key leaders. It examines who drove the violence, how the Anglo-Iirh Treaty divided opinion, and how these events shaped Ireland’s path to independence and its enduring political landscape.
the-irish-civil-war-20250706:5aeca01ce05.seriesTitle: The Irish Civil War: Assassination, Battle, and the Making of Modern Ireland

the-irish-war-of-independence-20250622:f.narrativeSummary: A four-part exploration of Ireland’s struggle for independence, tracing how World War I reshaped Home Rule and gave rise to the IRA. It follows the escalating violence, pivotal events like Bloody Sunday, and the political negotiations that culminated in the Anglo-Irish Treaty and its lasting consequences.
the-irish-war-of-independence-20250622:f.seriesTitle: The Irish War of Independence: From Rise to Treaty

the-last-viking-20250330:0a78935bd17da2c.narrativeSummary: Two-part chronicle of Harald Hardrada's extraordinary life—from a Norse warrior and prince to a Varangian Guard in Constantinople and back to Norway to claim a throne. It threads Viking audacity with Byzantine intrigue across Kyiv and the North, building toward the climactic clash at Stamford Bridge in 1066.
the-last-viking-20250330:0a78935bd17da2c.seriesTitle: The Last Viking: Harald Hardrada's Rise from Norway to Byzantium

the-medici-20250608:9c4af0a6b6ffb56fb09f.narrativeSummary: Tracing the Medici family's ascent from Cosimo to Lorenzo, this series reveals how wealth, cunning, and political daring redefined Florence during the Renaissance, turning a glittering republic into a banking powerhouse and cultural patron. But power bred peril: conspiracies, papal pressures, and internal ruin culminate in Savonarola's puritanical crusade and the Bonfire of the Vanities, sealing the Medici’s dramatic rise and fall.
the-medici-20250608:9c4af0a6b6ffb56fb09f.seriesTitle: The Medici: Masters of Florence — Rise, Rule, and Reckoning

the-murder-of-franz-ferdinand-20240630:a.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, the series traces the 1914 Sarajevo assassination that ignited a global conflict: how Gavrilo Princip and the Black Hand plotted to kill Franz Ferdinand, the fragile politics of the Balkans and the Habsburg Empire, and the grim moment that sealed the Archduke's fate. By examining the killer, the conspiracy, the victim's life, and the crime itself, the narrative shows how a handful of choices and missteps reshaped world history.
the-murder-of-franz-ferdinand-20240630:a.seriesTitle: The Murder of Franz Ferdinand: The Killer, The Conspiracy, The Victim, The Crime

the-nazis-in-power-20240101:e898c25c3a43.narrativeSummary: From the moment the Nazis seized control in 1933 to the eve of World War II, this series traces how a totalitarian regime consolidated power, reshaped German society, and expanded its reach across Europe. It follows internal faction struggles, the propaganda machine, territorial expansion, and the intensified persecution of Jews, culminating in the brutal events of Kristallnacht. Through episodes on the Night of the Long Knives, the Nuremberg Rally, rearmament, the annexation of Austria, and the escalating threat to European Jewry, the arc reveals how ideology, power, and conquest propelled a country toward war and catastrophe.
the-nazis-in-power-20240101:e898c25c3a43.seriesTitle: The Nazis in Power: Rise, Repression, and War

the-nazis-road-to-war-20250106:22c098bbb.narrativeSummary: Hitler's ascent and strategic gambits in the 1930s push Europe toward war by pressing claims in Czechoslovakia. The Munich meeting and ensuing diplomacy illustrate how Western powers sought to manage a growing crisis, often under the shadow of appeasement. Together, the episodes illuminate the fragile decisions that helped ignite World War II.

the-peasants-revolt-20240129:2fd0c618e5d.narrativeSummary: Across these episodes we trace how late medieval England convulsed under social upheaval, royal crisis, and cultural flowering. From the Peasants' Revolt and London's turmoil to Richard II's deposition, and finally Chaucer's Canterbury Tales, the era shows how power, protest, and storytelling together reshaped English society.
the-peasants-revolt-20240129:2fd0c618e5d.seriesTitle: England in the Fourteenth Century: Revolt, Reign, and Canterbury

the-peasants-revolt-20240129:e91940c13c5.narrativeSummary: Across these two episodes, we trace the 1381 Peasants’ Revolt in England—from mounting taxes and a weakened crown to a radical rebellion that challenged the feudal order. We follow the uprising from its southern beginnings to London's siege and the pivotal confrontation with Richard II, illustrating how the rebellion reshaped society and seeded a new strain of grassroots politics.
the-peasants-revolt-20240129:e91940c13c5.seriesTitle: The Peasants' Revolt: England in Uprising (Parts 1–2)

the-princes-in-the-tower-20220117:7fce36.narrativeSummary: Two-part exploration of the fate of Edward IV's sons, the Princes in the Tower, tracing how their disappearance became an enduring English history mystery and a touchstone of Shakespearean legend. Part 1 surveys the political context and key players of Edward IV's era, drawing parallels to later Tudor figures. Part 2 focuses on Richard III as the prime suspect and weighs alternative theories, examining motives, opportunities, and the legacy of the question in history and drama.
the-princes-in-the-tower-20220117:7fce36.seriesTitle: The Princes in the Tower: A Tudor Mystery

the-rise-of-the-nazis-20230116:c1bd80dc8.narrativeSummary: This four-part series traces the origins and ascent of Nazism, exploring the late imperial era, the aftermath of World War I, and Hitler’s early years in Vienna to illuminate the forces that shaped the movement. By connecting ideological roots to historical context and personal experience, it shows how fringe ideas evolved into a dangerous rise to power.
the-rise-of-the-nazis-20230116:c1bd80dc8.seriesTitle: Origins of Nazism: The Rise of the Nazis

the-rise-of-the-nazis-20230116:e2139bbb1.narrativeSummary: This four-part series traces the Nazi movement from its fragile origins through the Weimar crisis to Hitler's ascent. It follows key milestones—the party's emergence, the Beer Hall Putsch, the economic upheaval, and the political maneuvers that propelled Hitler from chancellor to dictator—offering a concise arc of how Nazism rose to power and consolidated control.
the-rise-of-the-nazis-20230116:e2139bbb1.seriesTitle: From Rise to Reich: The Nazi Ascendancy

the-road-to-1066-20250317:6edb4058d686b5.narrativeSummary: This series traces how England moves from relative stability to a brutal, transformative struggle that ends with the Norman conquest. Spanning Edgar’s death, Viking raids, Danish rule under Sweyn Forkbeard and Cnut, and the rise of the Godwins and William of Normandy, it maps the dynastic feuds and oaths that culminate in Hastings.
the-road-to-1066-20250317:6edb4058d686b5.seriesTitle: The Road to 1066: From Viking Wrath to Norman Conquest

the-road-to-the-great-war-20240714:d259a.narrativeSummary: Across six episodes, this series traces the July 1914 crisis from assassination to the brink of a world war. It untangles the web of alliances, ultimatums, and blunders—Kaiser Wilhelm’s Blank Cheque, the Austrian ultimatum, and Britain's decisive moment—showing how diplomatic choices spiraled into global conflict. A concise, narrative study of how a continental crisis escalated into World War I.
the-road-to-the-great-war-20240714:d259a.seriesTitle: The Road to the Great War

the-rolling-stones-20250420:db0d8a10cbf2.narrativeSummary: Across two episodes, this arc traces how the Rolling Stones emerged from postwar Britain to become symbols of 1960s counterculture, driven by sex, rebellion, and a relentless appetite for audacious rock. From their controversial early days to the perilous peak of fame—the Altamont tragedy and the era’s legal pressures—the series examines how the band both shaped and reflected a decade of upheaval and social change.
the-rolling-stones-20250420:db0d8a10cbf2.seriesTitle: The Rolling Stones and the Sixties: Sex, Drugs, and Rock 'n' Roll

the-roman-conquest-of-britain-20240929:7.narrativeSummary: From Caesar's storm-torn first invasion to Claudius's empire-building, the series traces Rome's forging of Britain as a province. It tracks myth, fear, and resistance—culminating in Boudicca's uprising—alongside the slow, far-reaching process of Romanisation from southeast to north. Together, the episodes reveal how conquest, culture, and rebellion shaped Britain's imperial fate.

the-trial-of-charles-i-20220127:d7f9704a.narrativeSummary: A two-part revisit of the trial and execution of Charles I that asks whether the monarch’s fate was treason, justice, or something in between. Hosts Tom and Dominic, with historian Ted Vallance, trace the buildup, event, and aftermath to reveal how this defining moment reshaped ideas of monarchy, law, and political legitimacy.

the-trials-of-oscar-wilde-sex-and-scanda.narrativeSummary: From brilliant ascent to public scrutiny, this series chronicles Oscar Wilde's rise to literary fame, the libel case, and the intimate entanglements that fueled scandal. It then follows his downfall, imprisonment, and the enduring questions about fame, sexuality, and moral judgment in Victorian society.
the-trials-of-oscar-wilde-sex-and-scanda.seriesTitle: The Trials of Oscar Wilde: Fame, Scandal, and Imprisonment

the-world-cup-20221114:615b1f65f1933c4d5.narrativeSummary: A three-part series that uses the FIFA World Cup as a lens on global history, tracing how empire, dictatorship, conflict, and globalization have shaped the tournament and, in turn, how the World Cup has reflected broader political currents. From imperial legacies and post-war reckonings to Cold War rivalries and contemporary concerns about corruption and globalisation, the episodes illuminate football as a stage for power, identity, and international diplomacy.
the-world-cup-20221114:615b1f65f1933c4d5.seriesTitle: World Cup and World History: Empire, Power, and Politics in the Beautiful Game

the-world-cup-of-gods-20210531:c7b26e938.narrativeSummary: This two-part arc follows a pantheon of deities competing in a World Cup-style tournament, tracing group-stage clashes and the ensuing knockout rounds. Hosts Tom Holland and Dominic Sandbrook break down the strategies, upsets, and ultimate outcome as they crown the supreme god.
the-world-cup-of-gods-20210531:c7b26e938.seriesTitle: The World Cup of Gods: From Group Stages to Knockout Showdown

theodora-20220808:21dee77c7fce8042364501.narrativeSummary: This three-part series follows Justinian and Theodora as they steer Byzantium through upheaval, ambition, and transformation. From the Nika riots and imperial defenses of Christendom to the reconquest of Italy and the plague's shadow, their partnership reshapes an era and leaves a lasting legacy. Along the way, it peels back the public story to reveal the hidden history of an empire in motion.
theodora-20220808:21dee77c7fce8042364501.seriesTitle: Byzantium Rising: The Reign of Justinian and Theodora

theodora-20220808:3bc629fc6ca8df97127389.narrativeSummary: This three-part series traces the rise of Byzantium through the powerful partnership of Empress Theodora and Emperor Justinian. From Theodora’s ascent to influence to Justinian’s reform ambitions and the empire’s capital at Constantinople, the episodes explore how their decisions reshaped the Mediterranean world. Together, they illuminate the era that bridged antiquity and the medieval world, laying the groundwork for the Byzantine legacy.

thermopylae-salamis-20210920:8b512247785.narrativeSummary: In these two episodes, the hosts revisit the Persian invasion of Greece, exploring Thermopylae as an enduring symbol of heroic resistance and Salamis as the decisive naval victory that saved Greece. They discuss how these battles redirected the course of history and left a lasting imprint on Western identity, celebrated in the 2,500th anniversary of the conflict.
thermopylae-salamis-20210920:8b512247785.seriesTitle: Thermopylae & Salamis: Turning Points in the Persian Wars

titanic-20240311:0a923b79458601cb7a84e77.narrativeSummary: Over six episodes, the series traces Titanic’s ascent as a symbol of modern ambition and luxury, its collision with fate, and the chaos of its final hours. It then surveys the aftermath—survivors, investigations, legends, and a cultural memory intensified by films and enduring questions of class, leadership, and responsibility.
titanic-20240311:0a923b79458601cb7a84e77.seriesTitle: Titanic: From Unsinkable Ambition to the Aftermath

trafalgar-20221017:d0b9320da97a35742cb1b.narrativeSummary: A three-part exploration of the Battle of Trafalgar, tracing the clash of navies, the innovations that reshaped sea power, and Nelson's decisive leadership. From strategic tensions and Napoleonic plans to a legendary victory and enduring legacy, the arc reveals how Trafalgar helped redefine naval warfare and Britain's global standing.

warlords-of-the-west-20241209:a1158139e1.narrativeSummary: From the collapse of Roman authority to the rise of the Frankish empire, this arc follows warlords, queens, and dynasts as they reshape Western Europe. Intrigue, betrayal, and monumental battles—from Fredegund and Brunhilda to the Battle of Tours—reveal how power, faith, and conquest laid the foundations for the medieval world and the age of Charlemagne.
warlords-of-the-west-20241209:a1158139e1.seriesTitle: Warlords of the West: The Frankish Rise and the Making of Medieval Europe

watergate-20211011:2c4036074571e48beb3e7.narrativeSummary: This two-part series delves into the Watergate saga, tracing Nixon's rise, the paranoia that fueled the cover-up, and the unraveling of the conspiracy. By examining the scandal's consequences, it shows how Watergate reshaped American politics and public trust.
watergate-20211011:2c4036074571e48beb3e7.seriesTitle: Watergate: A Two-Part History of Nixon's Scandal

world-cup-of-kings-and-queens-part-1-202.narrativeSummary: Tom and Dominic stage a World Cup-style showdown to crown England’s greatest monarch, drawing from a Twitter poll that pits rulers from Athelstan to Elizabeth II. Across two parts, they celebrate those who fell early and those who nearly won, weaving in surprising anecdotes, such as Henry VIII's hygiene, into the lively live-tour banter.
world-cup-of-kings-and-queens-part-1-202.seriesTitle: World Cup of Kings and Queens: The Royal Ranking

young-churchill-20221003:6f072a89c570ef1.narrativeSummary: This three-part arc traces the formative years of Winston Churchill, from a sense of destiny and leadership to his imperial adventures. It follows his evolution as a Soldier of Empire, culminating in a daring prisoner-turned-escape narrative that foreshadows the resilience and audacity of the future statesman.
young-churchill-20221003:6f072a89c570ef1.seriesTitle: Young Churchill: Destiny, Duty, and Escape

young-cleopatra-20220613:1e3d630d0053a90.narrativeSummary: A four-part chronicle tracing Cleopatra's ascent from a young queen in Ptolemaic Egypt to a central player in Roman politics through alliances with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony. The arc culminates in Octavian's victory and Cleopatra's downfall, highlighting how power, strategy, and external forces shaped her fate more than romance. Through historians' lens, it unpacks the costs of empire, ambition, and loyalty in one of history's most enduring stories.
young-cleopatra-20220613:1e3d630d0053a90.seriesTitle: Cleopatra: Rise, Rivalry, and the Fall of an Empire

young-cleopatra-20220613:1ee3bb75ca92d19.narrativeSummary: Across four episodes, this mini-series traces Cleopatra's journey from a young queen in Ptolemaic Egypt to a formidable political force built through landmark alliances with Rome. From Julius Caesar to Mark Antony, her story unfolds through partnership, power, and ambition, culminating in Cleopatra's dramatic downfall. This concise arc reframes Cleopatra as a strategist shaping her era as much by alliance as by authority.

young-napoleon-20231030:f99c2dc575e48c00.narrativeSummary: This two-part series follows Napoleon Bonaparte’s formative years, from his Corsican upbringing and exposure to revolutionary ideals to his dramatic rise within the French military during the Revolution. It traces how his early ambitions, tactical genius, and evolving loyalties—culminating in key moments like Toulon, the Paris mob, and the meeting with Josephine—foreshadow the path from teenage revolutionary to future emperor.
young-napoleon-20231030:f99c2dc575e48c00.seriesTitle: Young Napoleon: From Corsican Roots to Revolutionary Rise
